definition: to set on fire/to commit arson/to create a disturbance
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
only the official is allowed to light the fire/Gods may do what cattle may not/quod licet Iovi, non licet bovi
pinyin: zhi3 xu3 zhou1 guan1 fang4 huo3 , bu4 xu3 bai3 xing4 dian3 deng1
containing_words.word: 只许州官放火，不许百姓点灯

sentences.english: "Why do you have to put the ham in it?
sentences.chinese: “为什么你们要在里面放火腿呢？”

sentences.english: But I set fire to the rain.
The police blamed him of setting fire to the building.
sentences.chinese: 这个警察责备他放火烧了这个建筑。

sentences.english: Who set fire to the city of Rome?
Then they set our houses on fire.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们放火烧掉我们的房子。

sentences.english: The Babylonians who are attacking this city will come in and set it on fire;
sentences.chinese: 攻城的迦勒底人必来放火焚烧这城和其中的房屋。

sentences.english: The managers were questioned by police and finally admitted setting the fire.
sentences.chinese: 这两位经理被警察侦讯，最后承认放火。

sentences.english: Protesters have demonised him and torched his company headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们将之视为魔鬼，放火焚烧了他公司总部。

sentences.english: At least two of these multi-million-dollar aircraft were set ablaze.
sentences.chinese: 这种战机价值数亿美元，至少两架被放火焚烧。

sentences.english: Rioters set fire to a whole row of stores.
sentences.chinese: 暴徒们放火点燃了整排商铺。

sentences.english: They avenged his death by burning the village .
sentences.chinese: 他们放火烧了村子为他的死进行报仇。

sentences.english: Others told the visiting group that the fire may have been part of an effort to clear land for the expansion of a cattle farm.
sentences.chinese: 其他人则告诉考察团放火可能是为了烧山养牛。

sentences.english: The owner intended to set fire to the house so as to obtain great sums of money from the insurance companies.
sentences.chinese: 房东想要放火烧房，以便向保险公司领取一大笔钱。

sentences.english: Because he set fire to a house and tried to fired at me.
sentences.chinese: 因为他放火烧了一栋房子并且蓄意向我开枪。

sentences.english: White lotus claimed that if we do not surrender the princess will set fire to the Shen garden.
sentences.chinese: 白玉莲声称如再不交出公主就放火烧了沈园。

sentences.english: One yuan, but set fire to burn up medicine, and jump ship to escape.
sentences.chinese: 一元等惟有放火把药材烧掉，并跳船逃走。

definition: to set on fire/to commit arson
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
to massacre everyone in a captured city
